VEDA Documentation

Documentation about VEDA APIs, Datasets and Analytics Platforms

Welcome

This website provides documentation and example notebooks for the various APIs, datasets and analytics platforms maintained by NASA VEDA project. The intended audience is anyone who plans to use those backend systems.

This website is based off https://github.com/Openscapes/quarto-website-tutorial.

What is VEDA?

VEDA is NASA’s Visualization, Exploration, and Data Analysis (VEDA) project. It is an open-source science cyberinfrastructure for data processing, visualization, exploration, and geographic information systems (GIS) capabilities.

Learn more at https://www.earthdata.nasa.gov/esds/veda.

What can you do with VEDA?

Explore: Available to anyone, you can visit the VEDA dashboard to explore data and stories developed by NASA scientific community at https://earthdata.nasa.gov/dashboard.

Analyze: Coming soon, anyone will be able to explore VEDA datasets and stories using a notebook environment. If you are a scientist affiliated with NASA projects such as EIS and MAAP you should have access to a notebook environment associated with those projects.

What’s here

  • Documentation on VEDA datasets and APIs.

What’s coming

  • Documentation for scientists on how to get started with the analytics platforms.
